Package Assignment

Class CheckDate

java.lang.Object
Assignment.CheckDate
public class CheckDate extends Object
Check if date inputed by user is in the correct format.
Author:
joel, jin rui, jamie, tan yu

  • Constructor Details

    • CheckDate

      public CheckDate()

  • Method Details

    • checkFormat

      public static Boolean checkFormat(String date)
      Checks the format of the date based on the YYYY-MM-DD format.
      Parameters:
      date - The user input date read in as string.
      Returns:
      A boolean value as to whether the date format is correct.

    • lengthCheck

      public static Boolean lengthCheck(String date)
      Checks the format of the date based on the length of the date. The length of the date should be 10.
      Parameters:
      date - The user input date read in as string.
      Returns:
      A boolean value as to whether the length of the string is 10.

    • checkYear

      public static Boolean checkYear(String date)
      Checks the format of the date based on the year of the date inputed. As the current year is 2022, only years (YYYY) greater than or equals to 2022 is considered valid.
      Parameters:
      date - The user input date read in as string.
      Returns:
      A boolean value as to whether the year of the date is greater than or equals to 2022.

    • checkMonth

      public static Boolean checkMonth(String date)
      Checks the format of the date based on the month of the date inputed. As there is only 12 months in a year, the month (MM) values should be between 1 and 12 inclusive.
      Parameters:
      date - The user input date read in as string.
      Returns:
      A boolean value as to whether the month of the date is between 1 and 12 inclusive.

    • checkDate

      public static Boolean checkDate(String date)
      Checks the format of the date based on the day of the date inputed. Here we assume that there are only dates (DD) from 1 to 30 inclusive. Dates out of that range are considered invalid.
      Parameters:
      date - The user input date read in as string.
      Returns:
      A boolean value as to whether the month of the date is between 1 and 30 inclusive.

    • getInput

      public static String getInput(String date)
      Checks the format of the date based on 5 conditions: 1. Correct YYYY-MM-DD format, 2. Correct length of the date in string (length of 10) 3. Correct year 4. Correct month 5. Correct date
      Parameters:
      date - The user input date read in as string.
      Returns:
      A boolean value as to whether the check-in date or check-out date provided by user is acceptable.
